folder: Melvin Avenue & Wild Avenue, Staten Island, NY
text:
Melvin Avenue (right), at the N.E. corner of Wild Avenue. The building is on the Louis Schmul property and was, presumable, a dance hall for the citizenry of Linoleumville.

May 19, 1932

P. L. Sperr

folder: Wild Avenue & Melvin Avenue, Staten Island, NY
text:
Wild Avenue, east side, between Melvin Avenue and Pearson Street, showing an old house on the Louis Schmul property. This property was dedicated, in April, 1939, as Schmul Park, after Louis Schmul donated the land to the City of New York to be developed as a public park and children's playground. For additional information see "The New York Times," April 21, 1939.

P. L. Sperr.

May 19, 1932.
